articles.title: Space power China to build ground stations on Antarctica to support satellites
articles.description: The project was part of broader initiatives aimed at building China's marine economy and turning China into a marine power, according to China Space News. A Chinese-built ground station in Argentina's Patagonia has stirred concerns about its purpose despite China's assurance that the station's goal is peaceful space observation and spacecraft missions.
articles.content: China, only the third country to put a man in space after the Soviet Union and United States, is to build ground stations on Antarctica to back its network of ocean monitoring satellites, state media said on Thursday. China's global network of ground... [1877 chars]

articles.content:

articles.title: Argentina's grain export revenue plunges in January, chamber says
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb 1 (Reuters) - Argentina's revenue from exports of grain, oilseeds and their derivatives plummeted 61% in January from a year ago, exporters and crushers chamber CIARA-CEC said on Wednesday, in a setback as the country tries to refill foreign currency reserves.Exports totaled $928.37 million in the first month of the year, also falling 75% over the previous

articles.title: Chelsea signs Enzo Fernández from Benfica for British-record transfer fee of $132 million
articles.description: Chelsea set a British transfer record with the signing of Argentina's World Cup winner Enzo Fernández from Benfica for £107 million ($132 million), the Portuguese club announced on Tuesday.
articles.content:
CNN —
Chelsea set a British transfer record with the signing of Argentina’s World Cup winner Enzo Fernández from Benfica for £107 million ($132 million), the Portuguese club announced on Tuesday.
Fernández’s fee eclipses the reported £100 million ($1... [1653 chars]
